net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class ScrollView.Scrollbar

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.ScrollView.Scrollbar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable
    Enclosing class:
    ScrollView

    private class ScrollView.Scrollbar
extends AbstractElement
    The scroll bar that the ScrollView uses. It takes care of tracking its own position and being dragged, as well as drawing itself. It will not take care of updating its size and such, the scroll view will handle that (as the view has per-view of the environment)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scrollbar

        public Scrollbar(int x,
                 int y,
                 int orientation,
                 int trackBegin,
                 int trackEnd,
                 int firstSpriteID)
        Create a scroll bar at the given location, using the given orientation (which is either VERTICAL or HORIZONTAL)
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        orientation - VERTICAL or HORIZONTAL, the ScrollView constant
        trackBegin - The coordinate where the track begins. X or Y depending on orientation
        trackEnd - The coordinate where the track ends. X or Y
        firstSpriteID - The ID of the first scroll bar sprite to use in the SCROLL set (The top border for the scroll bar)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If orientation is invalid

    • Method Detail

      • initSprites

        private void initSprites(int firstSpriteID)
        Initialize the images for this scroll bar. They will be rotated depending on the orientation of the bar, and will be left their original size.
        Parameters:
        firstSpriteID - The ID of the scroll bar's top border image

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the scroll bar, by combining all of the images
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • dragged

        public void dragged(Element dragged,
                    java.awt.Point start,
                    java.awt.Point withinStart,
                    java.awt.Point current)
        Handle a drag event by moving the scroll bar. The bar will only move within its track
        Specified by:
        dragged in interface Element
        Overrides:
        dragged in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        dragged - The element that was dragged. It may not be this element!
        start - Where the dragging started. I.e. where the mouse was first pressed down
        withinStart - The point within the element dragging started. Like with the other mouse events.
        current - Where the mouse is currently at. Can be used to find a movement delta or used directly.

      • getLocX

        public double getLocX()
        Returns:
        Double precision X location

        Sets both integer and double x location

      • jumpBegin

        public void jumpBegin()
        Moves the bar to the beginning of its track

      • jumpEnd

        public void jumpEnd()
        Moves the bar to the end of its track

      • move

        public void move(double delta)
        Moves the bar within its track by the given amount. A negative amount will move it towards the beginning, while a positive amount will move it towards the end. The bar will stay within its track.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount to move the bar

      • getScrollPercentage

        public double getScrollPercentage()
        Obtain the percentage of the way the scroll bar has been moved along its track. This is a value on the range [0, 1] measured from the beginning of the scroll bar
        Returns:
        How far along the track the bar is

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        How long the scroll bar is in total

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int length)
        Adjust the total length of the scroll bar. This will take into consideration the minimum possible size. It cannot be made smaller than that. Nothing will happen if the provided length is already the current length. The scroll bar will use its background images to make itself longer, the other images will remain the same size.
        Parameters:
        length - The combined length the scroll bar should be

      • getTrackLength

        public int getTrackLength()
        Returns:
        How much track the bar has to move within (end - begin)

      • setTrack

        public void setTrack(int begin,
                     int end)
        Set the track for this bar. This defines where the bar may move to. The bar will not move outside of this track. These are coordinates relative to the same coordinate space the bar is in. The beginning marks where the top of the bar may reach. The end marks where the bottom of the bar may reach.
        Parameters:
        begin - The top or left-most the bar can be
        end - The bottom or right-most the bar can be
